content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter located at (-3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (-3.5, 28.5).  
This structure is designed to extract items from the source for further processing.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest placed at (2.5, 17.5).  
– Factory burner inserter positioned at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT with a drop position at (4.5, 17.5).  
This factory setup is intended to interface with copper cable production via dedicated inserter connections.

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest successfully placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot target.  
– Transport belt segment installed at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest.  
– Depot burner inserter positioned at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP, with a pickup position at (3.5, 15.5) and drop position at (3.5, 13.5).  
This combined depot structure is used to isolate and redirect items from the extraction system into the production network.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Errors  
  – Repeated failures occurred when attempting to connect multi‐segment transport belts because the connection target was identified as a Prototype.SteamEngine rather than an inserter.  
  – To mitigate this, always use an intermediary inserter (such as a burner inserter) as the target entity for belt connections.

• Wooden Chest Placement Errors  
  – Placement attempts failed when the target wooden chest position (e.g., (3.5, 15.5)) was too distant from the player’s current location, and later due to missing items in the inventory.  
  – Ensure you move closer to the target position before placement and verify that the inventory contains the required wooden chest.

• Variable Handling Error  
  – An undefined variable error (“target_chest is not defined”) was encountered during the assignment of a target position.  
  – Validate variable names and confirm proper assignment prior to usage to avoid such errors.
